intro: Hieracium hypeuryum subsp. heteromelanum, commonly known as the pale centaury, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its pale-colored flowers and the presence of a short, narrow leaf blade. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
